intro: Richeria grandis var. racemosa, commonly known as the clustered richeria, is a deciduous shrub native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its flowers are usually pink or reddish in color and bloom in late spring to early summer. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
